Page | 1  
 
NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT 
 
THIS AGREEMENT IS DATED ON THE            DAY OF                             20__. 
 
 
BETWEEN 
TELECOM (FIJI) PTE LIMITED a limited liability company, whose registered 
office is located at Level 5, GPO New Wing Building, Edward Street, Suva, 
Fiji, (hereinafter called and referred to as “Telecom” which term or 
expression as herein used shall where the context so requires or admits 
mean and include the said company and its successor or successors and 
assigns) on THE FIRST PART; 
 
AND 
______________________ 
a 
student 
at 
the 
__________________________________ having the Student Identification 
number as _______________________ (hereinafter referred to as “the 
recipient” which term of expression as herein shall where the context so 
requires or admits and include the said Person and its successor or 
successors and assigns) on THE SECOND PART. 
 
RECITALS 
 
A. At the time of signing this Agreement the parties wish to explore an opportunity of mutual 
interest and in connection with this opportunity, Telecom may disclose to the other (the 
“recipient”) certain confidential technical and business information which Telecom desires the 
receiving party to treat as confidential. 
  
B. In consideration of the provision by Telecom of Confidential Information to the recipient the 
course of such an Agreement the parties have agreed to enter into this Agreement. 
 
C. The Recipient recognises that Telecom will suffer a loss if the Confidential Information is 
disclosed to third parties and agrees to restrict disclosure of the Confidential Information to 
those of its directors and employees who genuinely require the Confidential Information. 
 
WHEREBY THE PARTIES AGREE AS FOLLOWS: 
 
1. 
INTERPRETATION AND PRELIMINARY 
 
1.1 
DEFINITIONS 
“Confidential Information” means any and all the information, know-how, data and products 
relating to or concerning Telecom whether of a business, financial, marketing, product, 
technical or non-technical nature and whether existing in softcopy or hard copy form, on 
computer disc or otherwise which is disclosed by Telecom to the recipient and is  designated 
as confidential or is marked by an appropriate stamp or legend by Telecom to be of a 
proprietary or confidential nature, but does not include any such information, know –how, or 
data which is: 
a) 
at the date of receipt by the Recipient in the public domain or which subsequently enters 
the public domain without any breach of the Agreement; 
b) 
at the after date of receipt by the Recipient already known to that party 
c) 
at any time the date of the receipt by the Recipient, received in good faith by the Recipient 
from a third party; 
d) 
agreed by Telecom in writing to be information, know-how or data to which this Agreement 
does not apply; 
e) 
required to be disclosed by the Recipient, its agents, contractors, subcontractors or 
employees, either during the course of discovery in litigation or to any government agency 
empowered to require disclosure of the Confidential Information during the course of any 
investigation provided that the Recipient has first given Telecom notice of the request for 
information and has secondly, assisted Telecom in obtaining either from the Court hearing 
the litigation concerned in which case such assistance is to include, if Telecom has or is 
deemed to have no status to be heard on the matter, facilitating presentation of Telecom’s 
claim for confidentiality to the Court under the Recipient’s party status or from the 

 
Page | 2  
 
government agency seeking the information, a confidentiality order or similar protection 
limiting the persons to which disclosure of the Confidential Information is made. 
 
“Corporation” means a body corporate incorporated inside or outside Fiji. 
“Person” includes any natural person, corporation soles and body of persons whether corporate 
or not. 
“Related Telecom” means any Corporation, which is related to the party, or person referred to 
within the meaning as defined in the Companies Act (Fiji).  
 
1.2 
Any reference to a party shall be deemed to be a reference to that party and its Related 
Companies. 
 
2. 
AGREEMENT AS TO USE AND DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION 
2.1 
With respect to any Confidential Information the Recipient will: 
a) 
hold the Confidential Information in confidence and, subject to clause 2.2, will not directly 
or indirectly disclose the Confidential Information, or permit the Confidential Information to 
be disclosed, to any Person at any time, whether before, during or after the term of this 
Agreement and notwithstanding any termination of this Agreement; 
b) 
not use the Confidential Information, or permit the Confidential Information to be used, for 
any purpose other than referred to in Recital A; 
c) 
The Recipient shall keep Telecom’s Confidential Information, whether or not prepared or 
developed by Telecom, in the strictest confidence. The Recipient will not disclose such 
information to anyone outside Telecom without Telecom’s prior written consent. Nor will 
the Recipient make use of any Confidential Information for the Recipient’s own purposes 
or the benefit of anyone other than Telecom; 
d) 
restrict the disclosure of the Confidential Information to those of its directors and 
employees who genuinely require the Confidential Information for the purposes referred to 
in Recital A; and 
e) 
upon receipt of ten days’ written notice from Telecom, return to Telecom any and all copies 
of the Confidential Information and originals and copies of written summaries describing or 
incorporating the Confidential Information and will certify that the return of such documents 
is in full satisfaction of the Recipient’s obligation hereunder provided that where and such 
copy of summary has been recorded in a non- written form  (as in computer) then all such 
recordings shall, to the extent they contain or refer to the Confidential Information, be 
erased and the fact of having done so shall be communicated in  writing to Telecom or at 
the  Telecom’s option, such erasure shall be conducted in the presence of and to the 
satisfaction of Telecom’s nominee. 
 
2.2 
The Recipient acknowledges that it is aware that the disclosure of the Confidential Information 
to any Person would result in Telecom suffering damage. 
 
2.3 
The Recipient acknowledges that the disclosure of the Confidential Information may cause 
irreparable damage to Telecom for which monetary damages would not be an adequate 
remedy.  Accordingly, Telecom may seek and obtain injunctive relief against the breach or 
threatened breach of this Agreement in addition to any other remedies that may be available. 
 
3. 
INDEMNITY 
3.1 
The Recipient shall defend and hold harmless Telecom and its officers, directors, employees, 
agents, parents, subsidiaries and other affiliates, from and against all and any costs awarded 
by a Court of Law against Recipient by reason of: 
 
a. 
any failure by the Recipient to perform any covenant or agreement of that party set 
forth herein; or 
b. 
any breach by the Recipient of any representation, warranty, covenant or agreement 
contained herein; or 
c. 
the negligence or wrongful act or omission of the Recipient. 
 

 
Page | 3  
 
3.2 
For the purpose of clause 3.1, the Recipient shall be construed to include the Recipient, its 
officers, directors, employees, servants, contractors and any other Person performing duties 
under this Agreement on behalf of or at the request of the Recipient. 
 
4. 
TERM 
4.1 
The effective date of this Agreement is the date on which the last party signed this agreement 
and the confidentiality obligations of the receiving party hereunder shall survive for a period of 
three (3) years from the date of disclosure; 
4.2 
In any event, the Recipient’s obligations under section 2 with respect to an item of Confidential 
Information shall survive for a period of three (3) years the expiration or termination of this 
Agreement. 
 
5. 
WARRANTIES  
5.1  
The Recipient agrees that it must: 
a. 
Not make or issue any announcement or statement other than an announcement required 
by law in relation processes followed without prior written consent of each party; 
b. 
Ensure its affiliates, sub-contractors and suppliers (where relevant) do not, engage in 
improper collusion, anti-competitive conduct or any other similar conduct with any other 
persons; 
c. 
Where relevant, ensure each authorized person who is directly involved with, or aware of 
the terms of this Agreement does not violate any applicable laws regarding the offering of 
inducement in connection with services provided hereinafter; and 
d. 
take all necessary steps (including execute any agreement) and shall ensure that its 
employees and agents shall take necessary steps (including execute any agreements) 
that the other party may reasonably require to give effect to this agreement.  
 
5.2.1 
Each party represents and warrants to the other that at the date of this agreement: 
a. 
It is duly incorporated under the laws of the place of its incorporation; 
b. 
It has the power and authority to sign this Agreement and perform and observe all its 
terms; 
c. 
This agreement constitutes its legal, valid and binding agreement enforceable against it in 
accordance with its terms; 
d. 
It is not bound by any contract which may restrict its right or ability to enter into or perform 
the agreement contained in this agreement; and 
e. 
No resolutions have been passed and other step has been taken or legal proceedings 
commenced or threatened against it for its winding up or dissolution or the appointment of 
a liquidator, receiver, administrator or similar officer over any or all of its assets and no 
regulatory action has been taken which would prevent, inhibit or otherwise have material 
adverse effect on its ability to fulfil its obligations under this agreement.  
 
6. 
GOVERNING LAW 
6.1 
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of Fiji and 
the parties agree to submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts of Fiji. 
 
7. 
NON-WAIVER 
7.1 
The failure of Telecom to enforce any provision of this Agreement at any time shall not operate 
as a waiver of that provision in respect of the particular act or omission any other act or 
omission. 
 
8. 
NO LICENSE 
8.1  
Nothing in this Agreement is intended to grant any rights to either party under any intellectual 
property rights of the other party, nor shall this Agreement grant any party any rights in or to the 
Confidential Information of the other party except as expressly set forth herein. 
 
9. 
FURTHER TO THIS: 
 
a) 
Use of Artificial Intelligence Tools 
The Participant shall not input, upload, or otherwise share any Company data, 
documentation, workflows, source code, proprietary information, or any derivative 
thereof into publicly accessible artificial intelligence platforms, including but not limited 
to ChatGPT, Grok, DeepSeek, Bard, Copilot, or similar tools, unless explicitly 
authorized in writing by the Company. This restriction applies to both free and paid 
versions of such tools. 

 
Page | 4  
 
 
b) Ownership of Deliverables 
All deliverables, including but not limited to source code, designs, documentation, 
workflows, algorithms, and related materials produced during the course of this 
program, whether created solely by the Participant or in collaboration with others, 
shall be the exclusive property of Telecom. The Participant acknowledges and agrees 
that they have no rights, title, or interest in such deliverables, except as expressly 
permitted by the Company in writing. 
 
c) 
Prohibited Use of Project Outputs 
The Participant shall not, without prior written consent of the Company: 
i. 
Sell, license, or otherwise commercially exploit the deliverables, in whole or 
in part. 
ii. 
Provide, share, or adapt the deliverables for the benefit of any other party. 
iii. 
Publish or upload the deliverables, in whole or in part, to any public platform, 
repository, or code-sharing site (including GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, or 
similar services), whether public or private, unless expressly authorized by 
the Telecom. 
 
d) Return of Materials and Company Equipment 
Upon completion of the program or upon the Company’s request, the Participant shall: 
i. 
Return or securely delete all Company materials, including any copies stored 
electronically. 
ii. 
Return in good working condition any Company-owned equipment provided 
for use during the program, including but not limited to laptops, PCs, routers, 
peripherals, or other devices. Normal wear and tear is acceptable, but the 
Participant will be responsible for any loss or damage due to negligence or 
misuse. 
 
e) 
Academic Use 
If required for academic purposes, the Participant may reference the project in reports 
or presentations only with the prior written approval of the Company and in 
accordance with any redaction requirements to protect Confidential Information and 
IP. 
 
IN WITNESS WHEREOF the Parties hereto have caused their respective Company Stamps to be 
affixed hereunto two others of the same tenor and date as these presents on this _____ day of 
________________ 20__. 
 
 
 
Signed by TELECOM (FIJI) PTE LIMITED by its duly
